Hi there!

My name is Bart Rogiers, and I&apos;m a ([Bayesian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayesian_probability)) research scientist and the
[R](https://www.r-project.org/) community lead at the [Belgian Nuclear Research
Centre](https://www.sckcen.be/en). My current interests are mainly in [probabilistic
programming](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Probabilistic_programming), [procedural solid texture synthesis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procedural_texture), and empowering people with
[R](https://www.r-project.org/).

I live in the beautiful [Haspengouw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hesbaye)
region, am a proud father of two and husband to an amazing wife. When not
playing [retro](https://www.retroarch.com) or [voxel](https://www.minetest.net) games with our kids,
reading them stories about [Middle-Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle-earth), or practising [asanas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asana) and [taegeuk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taegeuk_(taekwondo)), I love
being creative in the art space.

You can find some links here to things I&apos;m doing out in the open. I love
feedback on any of these, so do not hesitate to reach out!
</div>
